review_blob: Good beer, very fruity, Very fruity and floral aroma.  Taste is of figs, citrus and caramel a little sweet for my taste which cost it only slightly in the ratings.  Mouthfeel is good and finish is pleseant.

Very good beer.  Pours dark brown with tan lacy head.  Beautiful boquet smell.  Flavor is sweet but not too sweet and lot less alcohol taste than i would expect from an 11.3% beer.  Very good overall, not quite the explosion of flavors found in the Westy 12 but my #2 ranked Trappist.  And I can now say I have had all of the Belgian Trappist beers.
This is one of my favorite Weiss beers.  Very flavorfull smooth feel and great aftertaste.
This beer is about as good as the 1. FCK team it sponsors.  Bad out of a bottle a little better out of the tap.  It is an extremely bitter beer with nothing good to offer to offset.
As is the case with most Bischoff beers this one is just ok.  Decent flavor and aromas.  Definitely not up to par with the big dogs like Kostritzer.
This is my favorite German beer.  You can lla have your Weizens I will take a Kostritzer.  So tasty and dark beautiful mouthfeel and an absoulte joy to drink.
Not my favorite Chimay.  Much more bitter than the other two with much less of the fruity flavor.

Had a glass at the De Vrede as I was waiting to pick up my two cases of the 8.  Rather than trying to use three thousand adjectives that make absolutely no sense at all I will try to descrbe this beer in English.  It poured very dark and with a beautiful head.  The first sip was a shock to the system flavor was sweet yet full of alcohol.  An absolutely great beer.
